instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
Hi,

I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>  <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A without power. (It takes 16V from bench PSU, and the amperage is very strange (oscilating bettewn 1~2A w/o battery). No fan spin, and CPU gets very hot, and thats with I try to don't take too long with it connected to the PSU.

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> = 0.002 diode reading.

It had corrosion on <CHIP>U7501</CHIP>, and so I've replaced it.

Now, on L7560 I have only 0.002 on diode reading, and comparing it with other board, it should be arround 0.400.

I've lifted L7560 and the low reading is on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_REG_R</SIGNAL> side.

I've injected 1.5V there, but nothing gets hot.

ON <RESISTOR>R7560</RESISTOR> pin1 (<SIGNAL>P3V3_S5_VFB2_R</SIGNAL>) I have 0.014 on diode reading, but I think I should have around 0.400. Already replaced <RESISTOR>R7560</RESISTOR>/63, but same readings.

Can you help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
How can a resistor pull down a power rail in diode mode???
Put some logic in your job and avoid wasting time.
Damaged resistors increase their values, usually get open; impossible to cause any short on (cold) readings.

Lifting L7560 didn't discard <CHIP>U7501</CHIP>; follow pin 17's trace!

If CPU gets hot when connect the power, I bet is the culprit.
When inject voltage, remove CPU heatsink first and check PCH's die temperature.
